content: Known for his theory of relativity, which physicist famously said, "Imagination is more important than knowledge"?

The physicist you're referring to is Albert Einstein. He is indeed famous for his theory of relativity, which includes both the special theory of relativity and the general theory of relativity. These theories revolutionized our understanding of space, time, and gravity.

Einstein's quote, "Imagination is more important than knowledge," reflects his belief in the power of creativity and curiosity in scientific discovery. While knowledge is accumulated through learning and experience, imagination allows scientists to think beyond existing frameworks and conceive new ideas and possibilities. This imaginative thinking was central to Einstein's own work, as he often visualized thought experiments to explore the nature of the universe.

It's worth noting that Einstein's approach to science was not just about mathematical calculations but also about conceptual insights and innovative thinking. His ability to imagine and question the fundamental aspects of reality led to some of the most groundbreaking discoveries in physics.

So, in summary, Albert Einstein is the physicist who made that statement, and his work and philosophy continue to influence scientists and thinkers around the world.
